reviews:
This is an excellent e.d.c light. It is very thin and light weight. It can fit just about anywhere. It uses AAA batteries that are fairly inexpensive and definitely easy to find.

The strobe is bright enough to be an excellent beacon or distress call.
For the price, it really is a nice e.d.c. flashlight.

#83 in Handheld Flashlights

review_title: Not at all impressed with the Streamlight Pro Tac series
reviews: The only thing i like about this light is the ability to us AS or CR123/RCR123 batteries. The body is way to thin, I feel like I might crush it just holding it. The body is WAY to smooth making it very slippery to hold. The optics are good. The clip is very weird it doesn't seem to fit on anything but the edge of a pants pocket. It doest "latch" at all and can slip easily off a belt it hung externally. In my opinion the clip is almost useless. The tail switch is junk, it's way to touchy, sticks out really far beyond the base so you can't stand the light up on end, and acts flaky if the base cap isnt secured very tightly (light just shuts off randomly). The actual button under the rubber on the tail switch is tiny which makes finger placement feel "wobbly" and awkward. I have Fenix & Klarus lights that I have been using for years and are built WAY better than this Streamlight...and have a lot more features. The only thing really do like about this light is the double tap strobe activation of the tail switch. That's why I am currently carrying this light with my sidearm....until I find something better. Might start checking out Coast lights, just got one of there pen lights, seems pretty nice.

review_title: Very nice flashlight, but watch which batteries you use with it
reviews: Flashlight is very bright, compact, and well built. However, it ships with Duracell batteries, and I don't think they are rated for the kind of amp draw this light needs to run on the high setting. I ran this light for 5-10 minutes on high, setting it on it's end cap (candle mode), and after about 5 minutes, the light tipped over. I picked it up, and the rubber cap was pushed out like it was under pressure, and the housing of the flashlight was HOT. I shut it off and let it cool off, then inspected the batteries. They appeared normal, but I don't trust them. I have some Streamlight brand batteries I am going to try next. I'd suggest not leaving this flashlight unattended if you are using it on high - at least not with the stock batteries it ships with.

#83 in Handheld Flashlights

review_title: if you enjoy losing a penlight soon after purchasing it, then this is the item for you.
reviews:
if you enjoy losing a penlight soon after purchasing it, then this is the item for you.

I've purchased this light twice, once in March 2014 and again in July 2014. I was happy with the light output, although it seems to eat up high-end batteries quickly. It was also happy with the relatively small size and light weight.

However, this light has an Achilles' heel: the retaining clip.

Soon after purchasing the light in March, I found it on the ground next to where I had been sitting. I placed it back in my pocket, using the retaining clip to secure it to the inside of my pocket. A few hours later, I once again found the light on the ground. This phenomenon occurred a few more times over the course of a month until the light became lost for good.

Because I was happy with the light output, I decided to purchase a second penlight when it went on sale on Amazon. The new light also fell out of my pocket several times even though it was tightly secured to the inside of my pocket.

Unfortunately, after only a few weeks of use, this second light also became lost for good.

Suffice to say, the retaining clip on this light is much too loose. In fact, I've had the entire clip detach and remain clipped to my pocket when pulling the light out.

Don't waste your money.
product_name: Streamlight 88065 Pro Tac HL-X 1,000 Lumen Professional Tactical Flashlight with High/Low/Strobe Dual Fuel use 2X CR123A or 1x 18650 Rechargeable Li-ion Batteries and Holster

review_title: A tremendous, versatile light for any use.
reviews:
This light can't be beat. Very bright, illuminates large swathes. instantaneous on/off with a light tap on the button. double tap before clicking for a dimmer beam (useful at times when you don't wan't to blind yourself in the dark), triple tap before clicking for a strobe.

Accepts two battery types: AA + CR123. This is like a revolver that can accept .357 mag or .38 spl. 'Nuff said. Comes with one of each battery and a nylon holster.

Two way clip can be used to hold it in a pocket or backwards onto the brim of a hat.

I've used this in the woods on camping trips, on the roadside helping stranded motorists, and in the military to illuminate my surroundings. No complaints in any setting.

#83 in Handheld Flashlights

reviews:
I bought the duel fuel single AA/cr123 light. I like it a lot and I'm a lifetime Streamlight customer. It looks like they updated the design from some of the older lights that I have. I like what they have done, this one has checkering in stead of serrations on the battery cap and they give you a much firmer grip. One thing to note, with streamlight products they use the battery very efficiently so they work like new right up until the battery dies. The beam doesn't get dimmer until about 30 seconds before it dies. One thing I noticed is that when the battery is getting weak there is a momentary delay of the beam when you push the button. I thought it might be a defective light but I changed batteries and it fixed the issue. So consider that your "low battery" indicator.

It has a white light beam and I was able to reach about 50 yards with it using the AA batteries. It reached further but I wouldn't try to use it much further. I wouldn't consider it a for a weapon light. With a cr123 the beam is brighter but I haven't tested the range with it yet.

Overall it's a great light, like everything I have from them and I'll buy at least one more for in my car.

I almost gave this four stars because of the piece of paper they place in the battery tube with out any info that I could find. I want to thank the folks who responded to my question about this piece when it didn't work with the batteries included and brand new ones that I had. I had a hard time getting the "warning" info out of the tube after putting the batteries in a couple of times. I ended up using a bamboo skewer to get it out. There should be some warning that the paper is in the tube because I have never had this problem with any of the lights I have owned through the years.
Now, the light puts out a ton of light and illuminates the woods behind my house. It's light and compact with a nice sturdy clip and holster. I thought it was a nice touch to include three CR123 batteries, too. Nice flashlight!!

#83 in Handheld Flashlights

review_title: Could be my all time favorite light!!!
reviews:
I have been playing with flashlights since i was probably 5 years old( I am 51). They have come a long way! I have a Streamlight stylus Pro 2aaa, and I use it everyday at work. I thought it was just about perfect, but I would have liked a high and low setting. I looked around and just couldn't find one that would match the Streamlight quality. Then I ran across the Pro Tac 2aaa. I ordered it and it arrived today. After playing with the different modes, I have to say it is a little closer to perfection. It took me a little time to figure out how to select the different modes available, but I think I have it down, now. Build quality is fantastic! Get one while you can..

PROS:
just a little bigger than the stylus pro
3 pretty good modes
great build quality
30 plus hours on low

CONS:
mode selection is a little confusing at first
could live without the strobe feature, and wish I could get to low without going through strobe

#83 in Handheld Flashlights

review_title: ProTac HL 4 2200 lumens , do you like to tap dance 10 times
reviews: I absolutely love this flashlight.You can use any protected 18650 2600mAh 3.7v battery in this flashlight. I tested this HL 4 with my olight,fenix ,orbitron and ebl batteries, worked as advertised. No overheating issues. This flashlight has a very good spot pattern which I can easily identify something at 300-400 ft, it has somewhat of a tiny flood pattern which I like. Here's the bad news, (Problem #1) The Ten tap is garbage, the interface on this is very slow ,if you're trying to run through the settings fast, this becomes very tedious. Unlike the interface systems of Fenix, olight ,ThruNite , Nightcore and wow tech. You can move through those settings lightning fast (Problem # 2) I used two different lumens meters to check the Candela. My findings were just under 2000 lumens( with Streamlight batteries) that's not an issue for what I use it for. This is a great flashlight at a phenomenal price point. Overall this flashlight has the look and feel of tactical but, this is more suited for search and rescue or spotting objects near your backyard shed.

review_title: The switch is too hard to actuate
reviews:
I bought one of these and when it arrived I found I couldn't actuate the switch with my thumb while holding the flashlight in the same hand (and I have really big-strong hands). I thought it must be defective so i sent it back and got another one and it was just as bad. You have to press the switch really hard to actuate the light.

Also, it is not straight forward to switch between high intensity, low intensity and strobe, you have to do multiple half presses. If you want the strobe quickly in an emergency you wouldn't be able to reliably activate it. I am sending the second one back as well.

The lED light is noce and bring for a light of this size, the body is well made but the switch design ruins it.

#83 in Handheld Flashlights

reviews:
Great flashlight but bad battery. I really like the usb charge port versus the traditional stream light docking charger because there are usb chargers everywhere. I really like the flood and brightness of this flashlight.

However, the battery that comes with the flashlight really sucks. I did not scientifically test the battery by leaving the flashlight on till it runs out. I am a mechanic and use the flashlight to look at vehicles and peak at bolts and nuts I need to remove. The battery never makes it past lunchtime and it stays on the charger for most of the time.

I really need to buy a second battery for this thing. My other flashlights I've had in the past, before i lost or broke them, would last for days with the same kind of usage.

Slightly disappointed because I couldve gotten a Maelstrom Regen MMR-X which is almost as bright with the same kind of flood, with a much better battery.

Flashlights ive owned in the past include 4sevens maelstrom multiple models, malkoff md2, streamlight strion HL(also poor battery), streamlight stinger

reviews: I was skeptical at first because it was a 600 Lumen small flashlight, but it works great. Its like a mini Spot light. It gets a little warm after a couple of minutes of use but I guess thats from the amount of lumens coming out of it. I have had it on for about 25 minutes straight while boating at night with no issues. Only problem i see is trying to use the dimmer light on it is pretty challenging. I wouldnt mind prolonging the life of my light when I dont need the full 600 lumen. I grade it an "A". I gave this a 4 star because people usually read all comments that are not 5 star on a product and I would like this review read because if you are on the fence about this product, I hope my review helped you. I would reccomend it to my friends and family.

#83 in Handheld Flashlights

reviews:
I purchased this flashlight to replace my old surefire E1E. I used that E1E pocket light almost daily for 9 years before it finally gave up the ghost. Now, after about 3 months of using the Streamlight 1L-1AA on an everyday basis, can safely say I traded up with this light.
As a heavy equipment mechanic, I use the light multiple times a day to light up small and hard to get areas, and the beam has been more than adaquate for this task. I also work as an Uber driver in the evenings, and using this light on high power to make out house address numbers from the car very convenient. I also appreciate the ability to use either 123A or cheaper AA batts. While I usually use the 123A batts due to the better power and run time, I haven't had any problem at all with regular AA batts.
My only complaint with the flashilight has been that the finish on the light isn't very strong. 3 months worth of pocket carry has worn a good deal of finish off the edges. Dosnt effect the function at all, I had just hoped to keep it looking new for longer.
product_name: Streamlight 88065 Pro Tac HL-X 1,000 Lumen Professional Tactical Flashlight with High/Low/Strobe Dual Fuel use 2X CR123A or 1x 18650 Rechargeable Li-ion Batteries and Holster
rank:
#9,282 in Tools & Home Improvement (See Top 100 in Tools & Home Improvement)

reviews: Built like a rock - the housing for this light takes a beating and still lights the way out of the Hawaiian rainforest. It's very simple to use - just a simple push-button with the right index-finger. Sonny, my hunting guide from Kaneohe Bay, recommended at least 250 lumens to see whatever you are doing, and this headlamp provides it. Streamlight has been the Fire Dept. standard my entire career. This civilian model holds up to anything I will ever dish out at it. ALWAYS carry extra Lithium batteries, and consider getting a Streamlight hand-held light holstered on your belt, as back-up. In combination, it all was money well-spent.

reviews: This is one BRIGHT light! I had a Surefire Z2-S for my rifle, but it was stolen (by my wife). So I needed a replacement for it. And I really didn't wanna spend another $100+. So I stated searching for other lights. Came across this one. Did a bit of research on it. Read a lot of reviews from this site and others as well. Since the light got mainly positive reviews, and was about half the price of the Surefire, I wend ahead and ordered it. I fell in love after first use. The tailcap is great since you don't have to twist it for a constant on. And the click-to-change setting is really easy to use. I kept the default setting of High/strobe/low. I ordered an Olight 1in light mount for it for my rifle. Went on without a single issue. The whole unit is installed very securely. Can't complain one bit about it. As for the whole Surefire vs Streamlight debate, I've now owned both. And both are great quality products. The surefire is a bit smaller, but costs a good dea; more. This light is a lot brighter, but has noticibly more weight to it. So it really comes down to personal preference. I'm happy with the Streamlight. My wife is happy with my Surefire. This light itself has made a GREAT addition to the family. And has been worth every penny.
product_name: Streamlight 88065 Pro Tac HL-X 1,000 Lumen Professional Tactical Flashlight with High/Low/Strobe Dual Fuel use 2X CR123A or 1x 18650 Rechargeable Li-ion Batteries and Holster
rank:
#9,282 in Tools & Home Improvement (See Top 100 in Tools & Home Improvement)

#83 in Handheld Flashlights

review_title: Don't stare at the sun. Great light for multiple activities.
reviews:
I'll keep this short and sweet. This is a great light and it is ridiculously bright. Like, staring down the sun bright. I use it for deer hunting and it does everything I want it to and more. The two settings are perfect for walking to the stand (low beam) and tracking or spotting deer (high beam). The batteries are expensive and don't last forever, but what can you expect with that type of output? Some ppl may find it a bit bulky on their head...It's 730 lumens guys, not a pin light...come on. Bottom line: Excellent light, excellent price. Would buy again without hesitation.

I also use it for grilling at night, car repairs, "honey-do's" , and other assorted nocturnal activities (not those kind).

#83 in Handheld Flashlights

reviews:
All I can say is WOW. This thing is bright. It works as a floodlight rather than a spotlight and reaches at least 70 yards through our woods. We live in the country and I like to scan the area around the house before letting our dogs out; necessary since we have skunks, porcupines, coyotes, bobcats & cougars living on our property. Did I mention snakes? We've found 5 rattlesnakes and coral snakes in the past three weeks, so you nderstand our concern for safety and the need for a good light.

I have several tactical lights that the manufacturers claim have between 300 and 800 lumens but they don't come near producing the amount of light this one does. If you're looking for a handheld floodlight for outdoor use, this one is great. If you want a light for indoor use only, this one is probably too bright. It does have a dim setting but I find that too dim. It would be nice if it came with low-medium-bright options but for now it's my outdoor go-to light.
product_name: Streamlight 88065 Pro Tac HL-X 1,000 Lumen Professional Tactical Flashlight with High/Low/Strobe Dual Fuel use 2X CR123A or 1x 18650 Rechargeable Li-ion Batteries and Holster
rank:

review_title: this is no better than the cheap $10 imports you can find on ...
reviews: I bought this less than two months ago, and it already has a major malfunction. Basically, it doesn't have a "high" output anymore, only "low" and "strobe". The whole reason I bought this flashlight was because for $40, I expected something I could keep clipped inside my front pocket at all times that would always work, with HIGH output. I already have cheaper flashlights with low output that are smaller and brighter than this is now, and I've owned them for much longer than this one with no malfunctions. I thought that by paying more for a name brand, I was getting something of higher quality. I guess I was wrong, this is no better than the cheap $10 imports you can find on here, and it is completely useless to me now. Don't waste your money on this like I did.

reviews: I use this flashlight for inspections at work and have noticed a tendency for the light to switch to the bright setting without prompting when my hand bumps against something while holding the flashlight. The battery lasts a decent amount when on low setting, and the bright setting is pretty blinding if there is something that reflects back at you even a little bit.

#83 in Handheld Flashlights

review_title: DON'T BUY IF YOU INTEND TO USE THE CLIP FOR CARRYING
reviews: This is the 2nd Pro Tac 2L I have owned and I want to say first of all, that I love the flashlight, or I would have went with a different model/brand after losing my last one in an attic doing electrical work. So I just opened the package on my new replacement and the 1st thing that struck me is the pocket clip looks different on this one. Just eyeballing it I could tell that it didn't seem to fit correctly on the flashlight and it was a totally different design from the older one. The lip on the end of this one is totally flat where it catches your pocket so you have to reach down with your 2nd hand and pull the clip open to then push the light down with your 1st hand. So that just mildly annoyed me but wasn't the deal breaker. The deal breaker is that every time I tried to seat the clip all the way home in my pocket, the darn thing falls off the flashlight. I don't mind paying $40 bucks for a quality flashlight, but this makes me mad. It wasn't like this on my older one I purchased 6 months ago. I know the Velcro carrying case works well but that isn't my preferred method of carry. I carry my pocket knife clipped to my right pocket and my light clipped in my left.

#83 in Handheld Flashlights

reviews: There are two things I would change with this light. The ribs toward the bezel are flat on three spots to keep the light from rolling, but are still proud of the light body. The clip sits right on these ribs and makes the light snag a little bit when putting it into your pocket. Streamlight should either make the flat spots actually flat, or shorten the clip a few millimeters so it doesn't sit on the ribs. Second change is that the light does tail stand, but the button is a little bit proud, so the light wobbles when used that way. The button needs to be recessed another millimeter. I've been carrying this light every day for 4 months now and have no plans to replace it. Love the ten tap programming and elected to set it to high only. The coating is very durable and doesn't show much wear. Very reliable just like my other streamlight lights.

reviews: I not only ordered the HL 4 but also ordered the Streamlight 18650 barriers with a charger knowing that this light would eat up the CR-123 battlers if used at 2,200 lums. When I first observed the light I was disappointed on ther frosted lens. See I own many hi lum Streamlight flashlights and was a custom to the cristal clear lens on all my models. But while holding the light I fell in love with the rubber grip, none of my other Streamlights had this feature. When I first turned it on I now understood the concept of the frosted lens. This is night and day compared to the HL3 which has such a bright center spot, the HL4 does not light this way. It is more a flood light or area light which offers a very even pattern. Used at 2,200 lums it turns night into a bright sunny day. It is the most even light pattern I have ever seen. After using this for several days I can honestly say it is my first choice when grabbing a flashlight. If you are use to the center spot flashlights this is not for you but if your opened minded about change give this light a chance. It does have that wow factor.
product_name: Streamlight 88065 Pro Tac HL-X 1,000 Lumen Professional Tactical Flashlight with High/Low/Strobe Dual Fuel use 2X CR123A or 1x 18650 Rechargeable Li-ion Batteries and Holster

#83 in Handheld Flashlights

review_title: Honestly, stars are misleading for the price
reviews:
Just got this light. Got to say, nothing special here about this light. Not going to say I hate it, just that it's very disappointing.

Pros:
-It's a one bulb LED light
-It looks very tactical, so if you're going for tactical, durable gear for your vest, this will work (clip is helpful also)
-Belt holster works fine, nice wide belt loop for work belts
-People say this light is very durable, with long lasting batteries. I'll take their word for it in my rating

Cons:
-Lumens are not impressive at all. This is really why we buy these "hummingbird" style lights right? Super small size with intensely bright LED lights. For the size of it, it puts out as much light as you would expect of a cheapy light this size
-Light options: Who's going to use the low light, especially since the bright light is not very bright? If you want to put someone into seizure, then the strobe is handy hahaha. Could come in handy for signaling over long distances i guess. Really they should have skipped these features and focused on the quality of the light itself.
-Cost vs. Value of Product... this light loses. This is a $15-$20 light max. I've seen much better small LED tactical lights for much cheaper at various places like Home Depot, Autozone, liquor stores, even Walmart etc.. These have anywhere from 5-10 LED bulbs, SUPER BRIGHT, long lasting & perfect for tactical. I think because they can put *tactical* in the name, they thought it was worth more...
-Made in China (This really should be on every Amazon listing. Nothing against China, but I am American and believe in supporting my country's products. I wrote to Amazon CEO Jeffrey Bezos and his secretary replied back. She spoke very politely that this might be addressed, but I'm still having to roll the dice every time I buy a product on here. Here is another example of how this would have saved me time, frustration and money)

Summary:
If this light were $15 with free shipping, I would give it a 5 star rating. You get what you pay for, but $40 for a regular old light? I don't think so. I'm not going to return it, but I believe I lost money here.
product_name: Streamlight 88065 Pro Tac HL-X 1,000 Lumen Professional Tactical Flashlight with High/Low/Strobe Dual Fuel use 2X CR123A or 1x 18650 Rechargeable Li-ion Batteries and Holster

#83 in Handheld Flashlights

reviews: First i'd like to say that i own the Streamlight ProTac 2L and love it! Very professionally made. Length 4 5/8" long, and 7/8" in diameter. Fits very well in my chest pocket. I also purchased the Streamlight ProTac HL. It's length is 5 1/4" and it's head diameter is 1 3/8" across. Very well machined on both models. Don't expect the center of the beam on either model, to be sharp as like looking at the moon. Sitting about 8 feet from a white wall, the ProTac 2L's center beam is about 1 foot diameter and it's surrounding aureole extends to approximately 8 feet diameter. The ProTac HL's center beam is about 2 feet diameter and it's surrounding aureole extends to approximately 10 feet diameter. Both models use the expensive CR123 batteries and buying them at the local supermarket is a Sin! They wanted 13 dollars for a set of 2 batteries. Went on-line to BatteryJunction.com and bought a box of 50 which brought the price down to approximately $1.29 a battery, depending on which brand you choose. I chose the Panasonic brand because the current capacity of each cell was higher than your average battery like Duracell or EverReady. Both Flashlights are extremely bright and machined to close tolerances and would not hesitate on recommending either one.
product_name: Streamlight 88065 Pro Tac HL-X 1,000 Lumen Professional Tactical Flashlight with High/Low/Strobe Dual Fuel use 2X CR123A or 1x 18650 Rechargeable Li-ion Batteries and Holster
rank:
#9,282 in Tools & Home Improvement (See Top 100 in Tools & Home Improvement)

#83 in Handheld Flashlights

reviews:
The shine has to be comparable to 4 new automobile brights. Its difficult to comprehend the brightness, and it is constant across the entire throw. It can brightly light the side of a 200' wide building at least, and maybe double that. The build quality is better than my stinger led hp, the threads are very smooth and clean and it feels far more rugged, and the metal more solid. I agree with some of what the negative reviewer said, other than it seeming like a chinese knock off. Everything is very tight and finished with a solid feel and smooth exterior edges.
-Although its 1/2 shorter than my stinger it seems like a larger light due to being more bulky, where as the stinger is very streamlined. It weighs significantly more as well and is difficult to carry facing up in a back pocket, as the face is heavier and will tip the light out. All this information is in the description though.
-Instead of a reflector it has a diffuser, which seems to work great, so i dont see it as a problem, though initially i was concerned since it doesnt state this anywhere. I believe this is how they achieved the even throw.
-Its capable of crown and tail standing, as well as having flat spots along the sides near the crown to lay on its side at about a 10¬∞ angle.
-As the listing states, the ten tap programing allows customization, but not full customization unfortunately.
-I have used 2 18650 3500mah batteries and they work perfectly. Just ensure your 18650s are button top, not flat or the first will not contact the positive inside the light. The automatically adjusting battery bay is very impressive and works perfectly.
-This is one hell of a light, and I assure you, youll be laughing like a lunatic the first time you go shine it around your neighborhood at night. My only concern is that its so bright as to have no practical purpose other than lighting up an entire block party.
product_name: Streamlight 88065 Pro Tac HL-X 1,000 Lumen Professional Tactical Flashlight with High/Low/Strobe Dual Fuel use 2X CR123A or 1x 18650 Rechargeable Li-ion Batteries and Holster
rank:
#9,282 in Tools & Home Improvement (See Top 100 in Tools & Home Improvement)

review_title: Streamlight ProTac PT2L Tactical Excellent LED Flashlight
reviews:
I bought this very impressive LED flashlight almost 3-years ago and still find it to be excellent and a must have tool. Anyone considering a purchase might feel that this light is kinda expensive.

So, are there cheaper flashlights available? Heck Yes.

Can you buy a better made, brighter light, in a similar size as this Streamlight for less money? Not Likely.

Prior to purchasing this light I owned the comparable SureFire tactical flashlight. I quickly realized a person undeniably needs more than one excellent flashlight. Since the SureFire sells for three times as much as this Streamlight, I purchased this PT2L. (In the interest of full disclosure I actually bought 4 of the Streamlight units.)

If there were any drawback to this light it would be the short battery life. That is not a complaint just something to be aware of. I realized the expected battery life when I purchased these units, I consider it a fair trade off for the vast amount of light this thing expels.

Bottom Line: If you are hesitating the acquisition because of the expense, go ahead and make the purchase as you'll be glad you did. If you provide proper care this light should last your lifetime or longer.

While you are here on Amazon you might as well click over and buy the large package of the CR123 batteries as they also have an excellent price on them. And the 123 batteries have a very long shelf-life so you might as well keep a stock so you don't end up having to pay twice as much at a retail store outlet.
product_name: Streamlight 88065 Pro Tac HL-X 1,000 Lumen Professional Tactical Flashlight with High/Low/Strobe Dual Fuel use 2X CR123A or 1x 18650 Rechargeable Li-ion Batteries and Holster

#83 in Handheld Flashlights

review_title: Great Light But Can Get Warm
reviews: This light is as advertised. It is bright and light weight. It has a momentary on switch which is extremely nice. The only flaw I have experienced is the light gets really hot if used 10 minutes or longer. Not so hot it burns but hot enough you don't want to touch the metal casing around the bulb. The metal around the battery compartment and on/off switch do not get hot so you can operate it for longer periods of time without discomfort. Just be careful not to let your hand wander near the bulb area or it may nip you with heat. If mounting this light the heated bulb area wont matter because the bracket will be around the center of the light and the on/off switch does not get warm or hot.

#83 in Handheld Flashlights

reviews:
I am a firefighter and use the Streamlight Protac HL 88040. The Protac HL is an excellent torchlight, solidly built, durable, and has a powerful "ray gun" 600 lumen torchlight.

The Streamlight HL features: checkering on body for a good grip, a metal clip (mine holds a 550 cord lanyard loop), anti-rollaway ability, recessed tail switch, strobe feature, a nylon holster included, slightly brighter than the Surefire P2X Fury in both low and high. The Streamlight Protac HL can be weapon mounted.

This light is very bright and has "medium" throw with excellent side splash. I think its a very good balance, working well indoors without too much hotspot and enough distance outside.

I find the strobe feature is useful for signaling but soldiers and lawmen like it to blind zombies. The strobe did save me once by turning away an attacking pit bull.

You have to have a light which has a low power setting so that it lasts a long time. However, the low setting is mildly annoying because it actually "flashes" which is misleading about moving equipment (try looking at a ceiling fan or helicopter tail rotor with it).

The included velcro holster is useful and durable. A nice touch.

The Streamlight Protac HL is unable to take rechargeable batteries at this time and in fact it voids the factory warranty. Some kind of overheat/explosion hazard. Be sure to buy USA made batteries.

Equal to the Streamlight Protac HL is the excellent Surefire P2X-B-BK Dual Output Fury, Nitecore MT26, Fenix TK21-U2, 4Sevens X7 Maelstrom, and Klarus XT11 which are all in this same category. All are excellent lights, but I think the Streamlight Protac HL is the BEST IN ITS CLASS.

"Rover-boy, is that you out here in the darkness...? HEY!" (Get a good light for no surprises.)
product_name: Streamlight 88065 Pro Tac HL-X 1,000 Lumen Professional Tactical Flashlight with High/Low/Strobe Dual Fuel use 2X CR123A or 1x 18650 Rechargeable Li-ion Batteries and Holster
rank:
#9,282 in Tools & Home Improvement (See Top 100 in Tools & Home Improvement)

#83 in Handheld Flashlights

reviews:
I work in law enforcement, and Streamlight is the brand to own! I bought this light, due to its size and brightness. After 15 years on the job, and I've owned many flashlights in that time, and none of them gets this hot after just a few minutes of constant use. When you have to illuminate an area for a long time, because you and others lives are on the line, the last thing you want to worry about is a light generating so much heat, it hurts to hold it. Pro: size, brightness
Con: doesn't sit in a cradle to charge, gets too hot to hold after just a few minutes

It's a great light and I've always enjoyed products made by Streamlight.

#83 in Handheld Flashlights

review_title: Best AA LED Flashlight I've Owned
reviews:
Awesome flashlight with an eye-friendly smoother-wavelength light output. I've gone through dozens of flashlights trying to balance light output with battery run-time. The ProTac has a battery-sparing design allowing you to quickly cycle through three light output modes. It's easy to work in the cold, but like many smaller lights, if you're wearing thick gloves, you may have to feel the button a bit; however, it's much easier to use in the cold than any light I've ever owned.

You won't regret purchasing this and I feel comfortable saying that having owned so many lights in the past.

#83 in Handheld Flashlights

review_title: One of the brightest LED tac lights currently available....
reviews: Yes it's a very bright LED tac light (claimed 600 lumens max...) . It lacks a lanyard or lanyard attaching point. Has a pocket clip but I'm not sure you'd ever use it. The clip serves more as an anti-roll device than anything else. This light does not accept the common 18650 rechargeable battery cell, so you're stuck using nothing but CR123 batteries. This light vs. the Fenix TK series I would have to recommend the Fenix lights, for ease of operation and ability to use the 18650 cell. This Streamlight has a funky programing scheme to switch between the three available modes ( High-Strobe-Low and combinations there of....) . You'll probably wear out the end cap switch trying to change modes. The Fenix light uses a secondary button switch to easily switch between modes and settings. So yes, this is a bright LED light, but it's weird scheme for switching modes and inability to accept the 18650 rechargeable cell, no lanyard point, prove to be shortfalls that would make me look at other lights to spend my money on.
product_name: Streamlight 88065 Pro Tac HL-X 1,000 Lumen Professional Tactical Flashlight with High/Low/Strobe Dual Fuel use 2X CR123A or 1x 18650 Rechargeable Li-ion Batteries and Holster
rank:

reviews: I would absolutely purchase this product again. Having played with various streamlight and other tactical light brand products, I chose this one and wouldn't look back. I keep this hooked on a belt loop on my pants and can easily access it with my left hand. It is out of the way, small, light and BRIGHT! I would recommend buying the batteries in bulk, as they are about $6 each individually or $2 or so if you buy them 10+ at a t time. The battery life is acceptable. My only complaint is that strobe is the second option while the dimmer light is the third. I wish this was reversed, as my usual need is a dim light, but I have to go bright, strobe, dim to get there.

#83 in Handheld Flashlights

review_title: Great flashlight and good value for the money!
reviews:
Great flashlight, compact package, amazingly bright. I don't have a ton of experience with "tactical" flashlights, but I think you would spend a lot more money to find one much better than the ProTac 2L-X. The high mode is blindingly bright, with a small hotspot in the middle that evens out over distance. Pure white light that literally fills every dark corner you point it at. It illuminated most of my backyard during testing. Strobe has its applications, just not for what I am using it for, but is still a neat feature to have. Low is the perfect amount of light for most situations.

The Ten-Tap programming feature is cool, but I do wish it was slightly more customizable as I would like a mode with high on tap one and low on tap two and no strobe.

Great flashlight and good value for the money!
product_name: Streamlight 88065 Pro Tac HL-X 1,000 Lumen Professional Tactical Flashlight with High/Low/Strobe Dual Fuel use 2X CR123A or 1x 18650 Rechargeable Li-ion Batteries and Holster
rank:
#9,282 in Tools & Home Improvement (See Top 100 in Tools & Home Improvement)

#83 in Handheld Flashlights

reviews: I received this light a few days ago. I have other Streamlight lights and I am very happy with them. This is a good light the problem is the amount of time it runs on high (600 lumens) is very short. It is not meant to be a light needed for any length of time on high but more of a light that can be used as an everyday flashlight that has the ability to throw a lot of light for a short period of time or to strobe very brightly if needed. This is to be expected since it runs on just 2 cr 123a batteries. That being said I had earlier purchased an Olight MS20-X 500 lumen light and it does indeed last quite a bit longer on high. The MS20 is of course 100 lumens less and $20 dollars more. Both are good lights but if I had to pick one it would be the Olight. I will keep the 88040 as a backup, Streamlight makes durable products.

reviews:
I was about to send this back in for a return and noticed a few others on here reported light being DOA. At first i bought a new battery, thinking maybe i received a bad battery, but that wasnt it!

Deep inside, at the very bottom, a red sticker was laying down perfectly, as if it was manufactured that way. Took a pair of needle nose and fished it out, but it was down in there covering the positive connection conductor. Now it works as advertised!

#83 in Handheld Flashlights

review_title: I own several Streamlight flashlights and this is my favorite and the one I carry all the time
reviews: I own several Streamlight flashlights and this is my favorite and the one I carry all the time. The "dual fuel" feature is nice so that you can use either one 123 or one AA battery but it is also nice because it adds about an inch in length to the ProTac 1l model. (Non dual fuel). This makes it fit just right in my hand without being too short or too long. I found the 1L to be a little too short and the 2AA to be too long but this one is just right so that I can activate the tailcap with my thumb with the beam just at the end of my little finger. The amount of lumens with the AA battery is more than adequate for any pocket hand held light applications.
product_name: Streamlight 88065 Pro Tac HL-X 1,000 Lumen Professional Tactical Flashlight with High/Low/Strobe Dual Fuel use 2X CR123A or 1x 18650 Rechargeable Li-ion Batteries and Holster
